actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1049 — "To ensure that parents are aware of foreign influence in their child's public school, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 313).
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 1069.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4312, H.R. 1005, H.R. 1049, H.R. 1069, H.R. 2965 and H.R. 4305. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4312, H.R. 1005, H.R. 1049, H.R. 1069, H.R. 2965, and H.R. 4305 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 916. H.R. 1069 — "To prohibit the availability of Federal education funds for elementary and secondary schools that receive direct or indirect support from the Government of the People's Republic of China."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under Clause 5(d) of Rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the administration of the Oath of Office to the gentleman from Tennessee, the whole number of the House is 433.

Representative-Elect Matt Van Epps, Seventh District, State of Tennessee, presented himself in the well of the House for the purpose of taking the Oath of Office which was administered by the Speaker of the House.

The House received a message from the Clerk. The Clerk transmitted to the House a copy of a letter received from Mr. Mark Goins, Coordinator of Elections with the Tennessee Office of the Secretary of State, indicating that, according to the unofficial results for the Special General Election held on December 2, 2025, the Honorable Matt Van Epps was elected Representative to Congress for the Seventh Congressional District of Tennessee.
The Chair designated Mr. DesJarlais to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Dr. Yancey C. Arrington, Clear Creek Community Church, League City, Texas.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
